sub_topic: Determination of standard enthalpy of formation for a compound
message_1:
Determine the standard enthalpy of formation of methane (CH4) using Hess's Law, given the following reactions and enthalpy changes: 

1. C(graphite) + 2H2(g) -> CH4(g)      ΔH1 = -74.6 kJ/mol 
2. 2H2(g) + O2(g) -> 2H2O(l)          ΔH2 = -571.7 kJ/mol 
3. C(graphite) + O2(g) -> CO2(g)     ΔH3 = -393.5 kJ/mol.
message_2:
To determine the standard enthalpy of formation of methane (CH4) using Hess's Law, we need to manipulate the given reactions to form the desired reaction: 

C(graphite) + 2H2(g) -> CH4(g)

The desired reaction is already given as reaction 1, so we don't need to manipulate any of the reactions. Therefore, the standard enthalpy of formation of methane (CH4) is:

ΔHf°(CH4) = ΔH1 = -74.6 kJ/mol
